ProfileInformation.Author: captbinkbonk
ProfileInformation.Description:
Release notes:
4.3 - Fixed reverser

This profile is for the ATR 42-600/72-600 and the Honeycomb Alpha and Bravo. It is intentially designed to be functionally similar to my other profiles for consistency across aircraft. Almost everything is working but this is still a work-in-progress (for example not all annunciator lights are implemented yet). The profile uses 2 throttle levers (with reverse) and 2 prop conditioner levers just like the aircraft has.

A shoutout to Lewis Dinsdale for his profile which I used as a starting point for this one.

Prerequisites

1. Create a custom base profile for the Alpha and Bravo in MSFS. The idea is to avoid having to switch profiles within MSFS so you should have only 1 custom profile each for the Alpha and the Bravo. My Bravo profile is totally empty (no mappings at all) and my Alpha profile contains only the X and Y Axis for the yoke, some basic camera mappings, and mappings for brakes, parking brakes and rudder because I don't have rudder pedals yet. Here are my MSFS Alpha mappings:

X-Axis=Ailerons Axis, Rudder (Rudder only needed if you don't use rudder pedals)
Y-Axis Elevator Axis

Cockpit Camera
- Button 2 (white button on top of yoke left side) = Reset Cockpit View
- Hat Switch = Look Up Right, Cockpit Look Up Left, Cockpit Look up, Cockpit Look right, Cockpit look left, Cockpit look down, cockpit look down right, cockpit look down left

External Camera
- Button 2 (white button on top of yoke left side) = Reset External View
- Hat Switch = external view look up, external view look right, external view look left, external view look down

Instrument Views (you can opt to use these however you prefer)
- Rgt Blk SW-B-(right)=Toggle Instrument View 6
- Rgt Blk SW-B-(left)=Toggle Instrument View 5

Camera Mode Switches
- Button 3 (white button on top of yoke right side) = Cockpit/External View Mode

Brakes (only needed if you don't use rudder pedals).
- Button 7 = MSFS-Toggle Parking Brakes
- Button 8 = MSFS-Brakes

2. If you need a push-to-talk mapping for Vatsim etc., the fire button can be used (button 1)

3. IMPORTANT!! Calibrate your Bravo throttles in the OPTONS page of the Flypad. Here are the settings I use
- Thottle type = Dual Axis
- Reverser Axis = no (although moving the throttle levers to the detent/reverse position will enable reverse)
- Throttle positions eng1 (Ramp=12283, Notch=4532, Idle=-16384)
- Throttle positions eng2 (Ramp=12059, Notch=4404, Idle=-16384)
- Tolerances left at defaults (eng1= -100, -10 and eng2= +10 +100)

P=press, S=short press (< 1 second), L=long press (>1 second), U=up, D=down, T=Top, B=Bottom

Alpha

ALT=ACW External Pwr

BAT=battery, ext pwr (if enabled in flypad prior), emergency lts, main oxygen, TRU)

BUS1=DC Gen1

BUS2=DC Gen2

BCN=beacon lts

LAND=landing lts, logo lts (in the air only)

TAXI=taxi lts

NAV=nav lts, logo lts

STROBE=Strobe lts

IGN SW=
-Off=engines off
-R=Ignition Mode=Start A, Engine 2 start (Hotel mode supported)
-L=Ignition Mode=Start A, Engine 1 start
-Both=Power MGT=CLB
-Start=Power MGT=CRZ

Lft Wht Btn(fire)=vPilot mapping (see prerequisites)
Lft Wht Btn(top)=MSFS mapping (see prerequisites)

Lft Blk SW Lft-U-S=update Baro to current altimeter (same as pressing "B" on keyboard)
Lft Blk SW Lft-U-L=toggle Baro STD on/off (baro still shows STD when turned off - bug?)
Lft Blk SW Lft-D=toggle seatbelts, device signs

Lft Blk SW Rgt-U=Brakes - MSFS mapping (see prerequisites)
Lft Blk SW Rgt-D=Toggle parking brakes

Rgt Red Btn=AP off

Rgt Wht Btn=MSFS mapping (see prerequisites)

Rgt Blk SW T-Rgt=unused
Rgt Blk SW B-Rgt=MSFS mapping (see prerequisites)
Rgt Blk SW B-Lft=MSFS mapping (see prerequisites)

Bravo

Mode Selector=ALT,VS,HDG,CRS (unused),IAS

Incr/Decr knob=if mode-ALT, set altitude, if mode-VS, set vertical speed, if mode-HDG, set heading, if mode-IAS, set speed

HDG-S=Selected heading mode
HDG-L=Heading sync to current

NAV-S=lnav
NAV-L=vnav

APR=Approach mode (Localizer)

REV=unused

ALT=Altitude/Pitch Hold mode

VS=Vertical Speed mode

IAS=Speed mode

AP=toggle AP on/off

Gear lever=Gear up/down

Flaps SW=Gust lock

Gear lights=Off=Gears stowed, Red=Gears in transit, Green=Gears down/locked

Rocker SW1=Interior lighting

Rocker SW2=Fuel pumps

Rocker SW3=Hydraulics, Window heat, Probes (CPT, FO, STBY), ACW Gen 1 + 2

Rocker SW4=Transponder on (doesn't change value displayed in PFD but it is working)

Rocker SW5=Anti Ice

Rocker SW6=unused but I will likely assign something soon.

Rocker SW7=Prop Brake (for hotel mode startup - optional)

Trim wheel=Elevator Trim up/down

Axis 1=engine 1 throttle lever (reverse when put into detent)
(IMPORTANT! calibrate per instructions above)

Axis 2=engine 2 throttle lever (reverse when put into detent)
(IMPORTANT! calibrate per instructions above)

Axis 3=prop conditioner 1 lever (moves in ranges)

Axis 4=prop conditioner 2 lever ?(moves in ranges)

Flap lever=Flaps

Startup

You should be able to go from COLD and DARK to FLIGHT with minimal manual interaction using the following sequence

On flypad: Ground Power = on

On Alpha: BAT, ALT, BUS1, BUS2, NAV light SW

On Bravo: Rocker SW1 (optional), Rocker SW2, Rockers SW3, Rocker SW4, Rocker SW5 (optional)

On Bravo: Prop condition 1 and 2 to "Feather"

If hotel mode start:
- On Bravo: Rocker SW7 on
- On Alpha: IGN SW=R, wait until NH% > 60
- Turn off Ground Power in flypad
- On Bravo: prop conditioner 2 = Auto
- ALT off

Program CDU and MCP (altitude mode, lnav / heading mode, etc.) as needed

If hotel mode start:
- Rocker SW7 off (prop 2 should now be rotating)
- On Alpha: IGN SW=L

If not hotel mode start:
On Alpha: IGN SW=R, wait, IGN SW=L, wait for NH% > 60 on both engines
- ALT off

On Bravo:
- Prior to takeoff, set flaps lever, Flaps SW (GUST Lock lever) off

Shutdown

On Bravo: Prop condition 1 and 2 to Fuel shutoff (S.O.), turn off all switches
On Alpha: IGN SW=off, all lights off, BUS2, BUS1, BAT
